de.mrapp.android.validation

Class Spinner

  • java.lang.Object
    • LinearLayout
      • de.mrapp.android.validation.AbstractValidateableView<android.widget.Spinner,java.lang.Object>
        • de.mrapp.android.validation.Spinner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validateable<java.lang.Object>

    public class Spinner
extends AbstractValidateableView<android.widget.Spinner,java.lang.Object>
    A view, which allows to choose a value from a drop down menu. The value may be validated according to the pattern, which is suggested by the Material Design guidelines.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Spinner.SavedState
      A data structure, which allows to save the internal state of a Spinner.

        public Spinner(Context context,
               AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new view, which allows to choose a value from a drop down menu.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet

      • Spinner

        public Spinner(Context context,
               AttributeSet attributeSet,
               int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new view, which allows to choose a value from a drop down menu.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • Spinner

        public Spinner(Context context,
               AttributeSet attributeSet,
               int defaultStyle,
               int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new view, which allows to choose a value from a drop down menu.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

      • setPopupBackgroundDrawable

        public final void setPopupBackgroundDrawable(Drawable background)
        Set the background drawable for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; this method is a no-op in other modes.
        Parameters:
        background - Background drawable

      • setPopupBackgroundResource

        public final void setPopupBackgroundResource(int resId)
        Set the background drawable for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; this method is a no-op in other modes.
        Parameters:
        resId - Resource ID of a background drawable

      • getPopupBackground

        public final Drawable getPopupBackground()
        Get the background drawable for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; other modes will return null.
        Returns:
        background Background drawable

      • setDropDownVerticalOffset

        public final void setDropDownVerticalOffset(int pixels)
        Set a vertical offset in pixels for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; this method is a no-op in other modes.
        Parameters:
        pixels - Vertical offset in pixels

      • getDropDownVerticalOffset

        public final int getDropDownVerticalOffset()
        Get the configured vertical offset in pixels for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; other modes will return 0.
        Returns:
        Vertical offset in pixels

      • setDropDownHorizontalOffset

        public final void setDropDownHorizontalOffset(int pixels)
        Set a horizontal offset in pixels for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; this method is a no-op in other modes.
        Parameters:
        pixels - Horizontal offset in pixels

      • getDropDownHorizontalOffset

        public final int getDropDownHorizontalOffset()
        Get the configured horizontal offset in pixels for the spinner's popup window of choices. Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; other modes will return 0.
        Returns:
        Horizontal offset in pixels

      • setDropDownWidth

        public final void setDropDownWidth(int pixels)
        Set the width of the spinner's popup window of choices in pixels. This value may also be set to android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams#MATCH_PARENT to match the width of the Spinner itself, or android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams#WRAP_CONTENT to wrap to the measured size of contained dropdown list items.

        Only valid in #MODE_DROPDOWN; this method is a no-op in other modes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - Width in pixels, WRAP_CONTENT, or MATCH_PARENT

      • getDropDownWidth

        public final int getDropDownWidth()
        Get the configured width of the spinner's popup window of choices in pixels. The returned value may also be android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams#MATCH_PARENT meaning the popup window will match the width of the Spinner itself, or android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams#WRAP_CONTENT to wrap to the measured size of contained dropdown list items.
        Returns:
        Width in pixels, WRAP_CONTENT, or MATCH_PARENT

      • setTextGravity

        public final void setTextGravity(int gravity)
        Describes how the selected item view is positioned. Currently only the horizontal component is used. The default is determined by the current theme.
        Parameters:
        gravity - See android.view.Gravity

      • getTextGravity

        public final int getTextGravity()
        Describes how the selected item view is positioned. The default is determined by the current theme.
        Returns:
        A Gravity value

      • setAdapter

        public final void setAdapter(SpinnerAdapter adapter)
        Sets the Adapter used to provide the data which backs this Spinner.

        Note that Spinner overrides Adapter#getViewTypeCount() on the Adapter associated with this view. Calling getItemViewType(int) on the object returned from getAdapter() will always return 0. Calling getViewTypeCount() will always return 1. On API Build.VERSION_CODES#LOLLIPOP and above, attempting to set an adapter with more than one view type will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        adapter - the adapter to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the adapter has more than one view type
        See Also:
        AbsSpinner#setAdapter(SpinnerAdapter)

      • getAdapter

        public final SpinnerAdapter getAdapter()
        Returns the adapter currently associated with this widget.
        Returns:
        The adapter used to provide this view's content.

        public final int pointToPosition(int x,
                                 int y)
        Maps a point to a position in the list.
        Parameters:
        x - X in local coordinate
        y - Y in local coordinate
        Returns:
        The position of the item which contains the specified point, or #INVALID_POSITION if the point does not intersect an item.

      • getOnItemClickListener

        public final OnItemClickListener getOnItemClickListener()
        Returns:
        The callback to be invoked with an item in this AdapterView has been clicked, or null id no callback has been set.

      • performItemClick

        public final boolean performItemClick(View view,
                                      int position,
                                      long id)
        Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined. Performs all normal actions associated with clicking: reporting accessibility event, playing a sound, etc.
        Parameters:
        view - The view within the AdapterView that was clicked.
        position - The position of the view in the adapter.
        id - The row id of the item that was clicked.
        Returns:
        True if there was an assigned OnItemClickListener that was called, false otherwise is returned.

        public final int getSelectedItemPosition()
        Return the position of the currently selected item within the adapter's data set
        Returns:
        int Position (starting at 0), or #INVALID_POSITION if there is nothing selected.

      • getSelectedItemId

        public final long getSelectedItemId()
        Returns:
        The id corresponding to the currently selected item, or #INVALID_ROW_ID if nothing is selected.

      • getSelectedView

        public final View getSelectedView()
        Returns:
        The view corresponding to the currently selected item, or null if nothing is selected

      • getSelectedItem

        public final java.lang.Object getSelectedItem()
        Returns:
        The data corresponding to the currently selected item, or null if there is nothing selected.

      • getCount

        public final int getCount()
        Returns:
        The number of items owned by the Adapter associated with this AdapterView. (This is the number of data items, which may be larger than the number of visible views.)

      • getPositionForView

        public final int getPositionForView(View view)
        Get the position within the adapter's data set for the view, where view is a an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item.
        Parameters:
        view - an adapter item, or a descendant of an adapter item. This must be visible in this AdapterView at the time of the call.
        Returns:
        the position within the adapter's data set of the view, or #INVALID_POSITION if the view does not correspond to a list item (or it is not currently visible).

      • getFirstVisiblePosition

        public final int getFirstVisiblePosition()
        Returns the position within the adapter's data set for the first item displayed on screen.
        Returns:
        The position within the adapter's data set

      • getLastVisiblePosition

        Returns the position within the adapter's data set for the last item displayed on screen.
        Returns:
        The position within the adapter's data set

      • setSelection

        public final void setSelection(int position)
        Sets the currently selected item. To support accessibility subclasses that override this method must invoke the overriden super method first.
        Parameters:
        position - Index (starting at 0) of the data item to be selected.

      • setEmptyView

        public final void setEmptyView(View emptyView)
        Sets the view to show if the adapter is empty

      • getEmptyView

        public final View getEmptyView()
        When the current adapter is empty, the AdapterView can display a special view called the empty view. The empty view is used to provide feedback to the user that no data is available in this AdapterView.
        Returns:
        The view to show if the adapter is empty.

        Parameters:
        position - Which data to get
        Returns:
        The data associated with the specified position in the list
